page.title: 10HIGH HURSTWOOD C.E. SCHOOL
page.content: In the last 10 years the roll of the village primary school has dropped from 104 to 35 with 2 full-time and one part-time teacher instead of 4. The drop in numbers is mainly due to lack of children in a village where there is little population movement. The school is well equipped with audio-visual aids, its own swimming pool and a kitchen on site which means dinners are cooked on the premises. Annual events include a Sports Day, Concert and plays at Christmas. There are educational visits and the local environment is studied. Links with the Church are maintained by special services for the children at Festivals. The school's happy family atmosphere enhances the life of pupils and the community. It would be sad if it had to close.
